article:
ion]] 'Sulfotransferase's are transferase enzymes that catalyze the transfer of
 a sulfo group (not a sulfate group) from a donor molecule to an acceptor
 alcohol or amine. The most common sulfo group donor is 3'-phosphoadenosine-5'-
 phosphosulfate (PAPS). In the case of alcohol as acceptor, the product is a
 sulfate (R-OSO 3- ), whereas an amine leads to a sulfo-
 amine (R-NH-SO 3- ). Both reactive groups for a sulfonation
 via sulfotransferases may be part of a protein, lipid, carbohydrate or
 steroid.
